COMPREHENSIVE NUCLEAR NONPROLIFERATION POLICY. The United States aims to reduce nuclear proliferation by placing fissile materials under international controls, ratifying the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty, ending production of new nuclear warheads with Russia, and negotiating to reduce strategic nuclear arsenals. The United States and other nuclear supplier nations impose sanctions on individuals, companies, and countries contributing to nuclear proliferation. They also aim to reduce incentives for countries to acquire nuclear weapons by reducing regional tensions and strengthening security agreements. Additionally, they seek to increase the role of the United Nations Security Council in enforcing international nonproliferation agreements and adopt a policy of "no first use" with other nuclear weapon states.
